SENT.plain: The oxygen extraction fraction (OEF) at maximally vasodilated tissue in patients with chronic cerebrovascular disease was evaluated using positron emission tomography
The vascular responsiveness to changes in PaCO2 was measured by the H2(15)O autoradiographic method
It was correlated with the resting-state OEF, as estimated using the 15O steady-state method
The subjects comprised 15 patients with unilateral or bilateral occlusion and stenosis of the internal carotid artery or middle cerebral artery or moyamoya disease

In hypercapnia, the scattergram between the OEF and the vascular/responsiveness to changes in PaCO2 revealed a significant negative correlation in 11 of 19 studies on these patients, and the OEF at the zero cross point of the regression line with a vascular responsiveness of 0 was 0.53 +/- 0.08 (n = 11)
This OEF in the resting state corresponds to exhaustion of the capacity for vasodilation
The vasodilatory capacity is discussed in relation to the lower limit of autoregulation
